text: Knut Ivar Moe (born July 29, 1960 in Lillehammer) is a Norwegian curler and curling coach. At the national level, he is a 1997 Norwegian men's champion curler. ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !width="60"|Season!!Skip!!Third!!Second!!Lead!!Alternate Coach!!Events |- | 1996–97 || Pål Trulsen || Lars Vågberg || Bent Ånund Ramsfjell || Knut Ivar Moe || Morten Halsa || NMCC 1997 (7th) |- | 2006–07 || Niklas Edin || Petter Moe || Christoffer Svae || Håvard Vad Petersson || Knut Ivar Moe || Team Edin - Lucerne Curling Trophy 2006 - CurlingZone |} ==Record as a coach of national teams== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Year ! scope="col"| Tournament, event ! scope="col"| National team ! scope="col"| Place |- | 1999 || 1999 World Junior Curling Championships || (junior men) ||7 |- | 2000 || 2000 World Junior Curling Championships || (junior men) ||9 |- | 2000 || 2000 World Junior Curling Championships || (junior women) ||8 |- | 2001 || 2001 World Junior B Curling Championships || (junior men) ||4 |- | 2003 || 2003 World Junior Curling Championships || (junior men) ||4 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1960 births Category:Sportspeople from Lillehammer Category:Norwegian male curlers Category:Norwegian curling champions Category:Norwegian curling coaches
title: Knut Ivar Moe
